availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Blacklock (Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Frances Foreman Blacklock. Father of Amanda Blacklock, Edward Blacklock, Charles Blacklock, Mary Blacklock, Margaret Blacklock, Sarah F. Blacklock, and Fanny Blacklock. Farmer in Grayson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Ohio County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 69B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 163.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Caney, p. 728.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Cromwell, p. 151A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Sulphur Springs, p. 513A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994036, Grayson County Births, p. 4.
